file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-00-01-02 - LANDING GEAR SAFETY PIN - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LANDING GEAR SAFETY PIN - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to install and remove the Landing Gear (LG) safety pins. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND ALL 32-00-01-910-801-A REMOVAL EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-00-01 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-00-01-910-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LG SAFETY PIN - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL A. General (1) You must install the LG safety pins when the aircraft is parked, during maintenance procedures, and during the towing of the aircraft. The use of the LG safety pins is optional when you tow or push the aircraft for the flight. This occurs when the aircraft is in position for the flight crew to taxi the aircraft before or after a flight. (2) When not in use, the LG safety pins are kept in a recess of the aft console, behind the pilot seat. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP SAFETY PIN OF THE NLG DOORS SOLENOID AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200 VALVE - INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL SB145-32-0036 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH MLG, LH MLG, and NLG I. Install (Figure 201) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: DURING THE INSTALLATION OF THE LG SAFETY PIN, PREVENT SUDDEN AND STRONG MOVEMENTS OF THE AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT. THIS CAN CAUSE AN ACCIDENTAL UNLOCKING OF THE LANDING GEAR, WITH SUBSEQUENT INJURIES TO PERSONNEL AND DAMAGE TO AIRCRAFT. (1) Make sure that the landing gear control lever is in the DOWN position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 910-801-A/200 32-00-01 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) For aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-32-0036, make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system No. 1 is fully released ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, install safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Install the LG safety pin at the auxiliary brace strut in each landing gear. (5) Make sure that the red REMOVE BEFORE FLIGHT streamer is clearly in view. J. Removal (Figure 201) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Make sure that the landing gear control lever is in the DOWN position. (2) Remove the LG safety pins. (3) Keep the LG safety pins in the recess of the aft console, behind the pilot seat. (4) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-32-0036, remove safety pin of the NLG doors solenoid valve (AMM TASK 32-00-02-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 910-801-A/200 32-00-01 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
